A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Maybe I’m being a bit harsh\, but honestly I was really disappointed. It also surprised me\, because every pre-release review was “amazing”\, “fantastic”\, yada yada\, so I thought maybe it was just me. Then I went on FB after the movie and went straight to the comments section of some Star Wars related posts... seems about half of people love it and think it’s the best movie since Empire\, and the other half hated. It’s definitely a polarizing film. I need to watch again\, maybe I was tired or not in the right mood\, but I think it was definitely the worst of the Disney SW films... Barely better than the prequels. And that’s only because the prequels were frustrating and annoying\, this one wasn’t “frustrating and annoying”\, it just sucked. I mean\, some stuff was good\, but that’s it. “Some stuff”. Same with the prequels. Some characters and locations\, some battles\, etc were good\, but overall\, not. Not impressed with Rian Johnson for SW. I felt the primary plot line was weak and boring\, and did little to advance the saga. The dialogue was scattered\, much of the humor fell flat\, holes in the plot were patched with thoughtless fixes\, many of the reveals were incredibly lackluster\, and the ending was anticlimactic. Just couldn’t get into this one at all.
